channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No street lights, 2nd November
item.description:
No street lights working on Severn Road Area in photo is around the Severn Road area near Tamar Road. Unsure of how long but noticed tonight whilst walking the dog.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Severn Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham

item.title: Gullies Need Clearing, 1st November
item.description:
Gullies along the close are visibly silted up and need clearing out.

item.title: Disconnected Drain, 1st November
item.description:
3rd or 4th time this has been reported - it still floods at the first whiff of rain. Itâ€™s never drained since it was installed a few years ago - please send a camera down to confirm the issue. This water will pool and freeze across this junction this winter, where all the kids walk/cycle to Leckhampton High School.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No need for temporary light which is causing huge delays, 1st November
item.description:
There are currently temporary light on the St Marks end of Landsdown Road but there appear to be no works ongoing to require them. It is causing delays and tailbacks on what is one of the busiest roads on Cheltenham. Please may they be removed asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 1st November
item.description:
email rcvd 01.11.24 - You will have seen on the news recently that hedgehogs are on a dramatic decline and likely to become extinct. We have a good hedgehog population in Longlevens, especially Greyhound Gardens, but unfortunately we have had six hedgehog fatalities on the road recently. I know there is now a sign for hedgehogs you can use on the road and I am enquiring as to whether you would put one up on the entrance to Greyhound Gardens by the traffic lights? This would then at least act as a bit of a deterrent for motorists to reduce their speed and be aware that hedgehogs could be on the road. I would appreciate your thoughts.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in pavement problem, 1st November
item.description:
We have had a complaint from a constituent regarding the entrance to Sixways car park on London Road in Charlton Kings, I know that it has always been an issue, presumable due to the amount of traffic that passes over it, but now there are a couple of large holes that could be very damaging and there is no way to avoid them.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain cover close to 290 London Road is loose, 1st November
item.description:
The drain cover close to 290 London Road is loose and makes a loud clanging sound every time a vehicle wheel crosses it. Because of the position and the London Road being very busy this happens every few seconds most times of day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 239b, London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 1st November
item.description:

item.title: A Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed problem has been found, 1st November
